title: Bitcoin
summary: Bitcoin is a decentralized digital currency enabling direct online payments without intermediaries, operating on a blockchain network. Introduced by Satoshi Nakamoto in 2008, it uses proof-of-work to secure transactions and validate blocks. The protocol has a hard cap of 21 million coins, creating predictable scarcity. Bitcoin challenges centralized financial systems by offering a transparent, pseudonymous payment network with no single controlling entity.

factual.claim: Bitcoin has a fixed supply of 21 million coins
First real-world transaction was 10,000 BTC for two pizzas in May 2010
Global crypto ownership reached 559-590 million users by 2025

interpretive.statement: Bitcoin challenges centralized financial systems by offering a transparent, pseudonymous payment network
Creates predictable scarcity through hard cap mechanism
Offers alternative monetary system with technological innovation over speculative aspects
